reviews.review_msg: Great lecturer and his passion for the field is apparent. Like many others have mentioned, this course is a little harder for a 100 level course. However, the habits you pick up from this course will set you up for further university courses especially if you want to take more WL courses.

Mark is unhinged in the best way possible. He's very intense because he's deeply passionate about his subject, but it can make his class a little intimidating, especially at a 100-level. Do the conference if he mentions it, it's definitely worth it. A pretty heavy course, but my final paper for this class is one of my favourites I've ever written.
Interesting lectures but harsh marker.

Mark is a great lecturer and is very passionate about topics covered throughout the course. However, content-wise, this course feels a bit harder than a 100-level course. He is super understanding when it comes to deadlines or late submissions. Attendance is mandatory. Participation is also super important toward your final grade mark.
Mark Deggan was a good prof. He helped students get good understandings of what he wants done. Encourages questions and wants students to do best. Tutorial attendance matters

Deggan is engaging and passionate about his content. This course was hard, but worth it. He is encouraging of his students, but also doesn't sugar coat shortcomings. He sees potential and wants to help it be fulfilled. Do not skip classes and head the feedback he gives, and it will be a rewarding class!
Mark is very understanding and willing to accommodate for students. He requires the students to want to succeed, put in hard work and consistency.

Great engaging lectures. If you have a slight interest in literature and themes that are commonly brought up in novels, you'll enjoy this class. Dr. Deggan is professional and passionate about the topics he teaches and I would hands down say WL 100 is easily in my top three classes at SFU.

Dr. Deggan is a great lecturer and can make long lectures fly by. He cares a lot about his students and truly wants to see them succeed. He is very approachable and ready to help you whenever you have a question. His courses, however, are reading-heavy and require extra time to prepare for in-class essays and midterms.

Professor Mark is really passionate about his teachings and will be there to guide you with writing essays. Go to office hours if you need clarification on how he graded your paper, it helped me become a better writer.

Mark is an amazing prof! Ive taken multiple classes with him (both online and in person). He is a very dynamic lecturer (especially in-person) and he gets very excited about the course(s). He is very passionate and cares about his students; he WANTS you to do well so make sure to be caught up with readings. Super accessible outside of class!

That was a super challenging class and he is a tough marker. Having the chance to write your papers is really, really helpful but it doesn't get easier. He asks complex questions and the exam was really challenging. I would recommend this class if you want to get better at writing and are down to go to office hours. go to office hours!!

Mark is a decent prof, the topics he teaches about are usually very abstract so it's kind of hard to grasp what he's trying to say during the lectures. there are lots of readings it's hard to keep up! make sure to look at the reading list and make sure the books are to your liking. you'll need to write a couple essays/paragraphs for the final exam

Mark is an amazing prof. Imo, the course books were a little difficult to understand but Mark has always been available outside the classroom for help. He is someone who wants to give you a better grade. Moreover, I asked for an extension on one of my assignments due to medical reasons. He not only gave me abundant time but was also very empathetic

The course was chill with Mark but, he is a hard marker. I see him as a passionate prof but he will go on forever on his lectures. His novels were interesting to read but, it was sometime quite difficult to understand those concepts. For a 100 level course this course goes beyond your expectations, this course is NOT a Gpa booster.

Mark is super passionate about the class, and is actually interested in seeing you learn and do well. Most books needed are online and free. He offers a lot of extra help outside of class via in person or zoom. Was very Understanding if you need extra time on work for a good reason.
Mark is always available outside of tutorial for discussion. He always gives detailed feedback and his teaching style pushes you.
His class will push your to expand your mind and thinking. Don't take his class for a GPA boost.

The questions for the papers were extremely complicated for a first year course and his expectations for what was supposed to be written was nearly impossible to do with such little time/word counts. Made tests happen outside of class time when people have other classes and work. Save your time and GPA and do not take it with him.

Mark is a pretty tough marker, especially for a first year class. He also gave very little time to discuss themes of the novels with classmates, so I found it hard to fully form my own opinions and ideas to use in assignments. He was, however, very open to providing extra help and I found myself really improving my writing in this course

Did not enjoy this prof or class whatsoever. His exam questions were nearly impossible to understand. I took this class to explore my options and I can officially confirm that world lit is ticked off that list...

Mark is one of the kindest and easiest to talk to Profs I've ever had. He's super passionate about what he's teaching and will give you lots of helpful feedback if you ask for it. He even lets you re-do an in-class essay if you didn't do well on it. His lectures can be a bit confusing but his marking is very fair. Readings are short and simple
Super helpful, understanding and patient prof. Interesting readings and profound lectures.

Literally one of the best professors at the godforsaken school that is SFU. Beware, he will Not baby you, but it's 100% worth it. You'll come out of his class feeling accomplished and like you actually learned useful stuff. Good grade booster too, especially if you need a breadth course. The only class where I Actually Read Every Text. SHOCKING.

Mark's classes are very lecture heavy, and there's a lot of information thrown at you. I'd recommend just absorbing as much as you can, and if you are confused about anything, ask him about it in office hours. He really focuses on literary theory when analyzing texts, and his reading lists are very diverse and interesting.

Mark is really passionate about literature, he's very nice too and always available for help. However, despite saying his course is easy because he outlines his expectations, he isn't so clear and it's hard to tell how he wants things done  he marks pretty harshly too. Course if fairly difficult especially if you're not a good writer
I hated this prof.

The online course isn't set up very well, unclear grading criteria and deadlines/grades weren't getting pushed out adhering to course syllabus. Assignment deadlines kept getting pushed back. Mediocre course to take as a GPA booster.

Great prof for any interdisciplinary look at literature. He gives amazing feedback on assignments, creates a great classroom environment, gives entertaining lectures, and is very available for extra help. Make sure you plan ahead. The multiple assignments can become overwhelming quickly if you leave things for the last minute.
Was very good at giving feedback, showed a lot of passion for the subject matter and for teaching. Wanted his class to succeed. Made lectures enjoyable and well paced.

Easily my favorite class of the semester. Mark's lectures are engaging and funny, and cover a range of interdisciplinary topics. Lots of presentation work in this class, but the grading was well spread out.

You can't go wrong taking one of Mark's classes. Highly entertaining lectures, a good, deep dive into the material. He's open to contesting opinions, and gives great feedback on assignments. This isn't a sleeper class. Go into it wanting to learn for maximum effect.

A great prof to take for a multidisciplinary approach to literature. Lectures are fun and interactive. The classroom environment is casual, allowing for an easy rapport between students and prof. Very available outside of class for questions or concerns. Many different assignments allows students to stretch grades over strengths and weaknesses.

Had to retake the course again in the Fall. His marking is very harsh and he doesn't seem to have a marking scheme, which makes it hard to do well. It would've been nice if he didn't lecture so fast. Most of the time it was hard to keep up.

Doesn't have empathy towards students. He likes to hear himself talk instead of engaging the class. He believes everyone pays attention through 2h of lecture with no break. You may write the same way, yet your marks will fluctuate. Even if you follow the feedback he gives you, it won't change your mark in future papers. He made the midterm 3h long.

Really enjoyable lectures that are super informative and on topic. Clearly cares about the material, which is kind of inspirational to see. Super clear with what he wants in the essays and gives a lot of great feedback on how to improve your work. Not a harsh grader if you actually follow his criteria,  but the material is pretty difficult

hands down the best professor you will encounter at SFU. If you love literature and writing don't finish your degree without taking one of his classes. Caring, funny, interesting lectures, always encouraging and ready to help. Mark is one of the few profs that really helped me improve my writing. Really could not recommend more!

Mark is one of the best profs at Sfu! His lectures are always super interesting, he's very encouraging and always willing to help students with papers. I've really learned a lot from his classes, would highly recommend!

Mark is very fun and interesting as a person, however he is a tough grader and not very clear in what he wants. Unless you are very good at writing I would not recommend him. However, he is very willing to hep and give extra work. He will encourage you to succeed but sometimes that isn't enough.

Mark is a very nice prof! He is very passionate about the subject and tries to make the content interesting for students. The main concepts seem big, scary & abstract but he simplifies it for you. He also gives good feedback on the assignments and allows you to rewrite them to improve your grade. He is always there to help & chat.
